properties.areaDesc: Medina, TX; Kendall, TX; Kerr, TX; Bandera, TX
properties.headline: Flood Advisory issued January 16 at 12:11PM CST until January 16 at 3:45PM CST by NWS Austin/San Antonio TX
properties.description:
The National Weather Service in Austin San Antonio has extended the

* Flood Advisory for...
Northeastern Medina County in south central Texas...
Eastern Bandera County in south central Texas...
Southeastern Kerr County in south central Texas...
Western Kendall County in south central Texas...

* Until 345 PM CST.

* At 1205 PM CST, Doppler radar indicated moderate to brief heavy
rain showers continue to produce locally heavy rainfall over
portions of the western Hill Country, including eastern Bandera
county. Additional showers and possibly a thunderstorm are
expected through this afternoon. This will cause minor flooding in
the advisory area. Radar and precipitation gauges show between 1
and 3 inches of rain have already fallen over northern Medina,
eastern Bandera and southern Kerr and Kendall counties.

* Some locations that will experience flooding include...
Medina, Kerrville, Comfort, Bandera, Ingram, Lakehills, Camp Verde,
Cliff, Bandera Falls, New Fountain, Old Tunnel State Park,
Kerrville-Schreiner Park, Quihi, Mico, Bankersmith, Cypress Creek,
Pipe Creek, Center Point, Kronkosky State Natural Area and Hill
Country State Natural Area.

Additional rainfall of 1 to 2 inches is expected over the area. This
additional rain will result in minor flooding.
properties.instruction:
Turn around, don't drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood
deaths occur in vehicles.

Excessive runoff from heavy rainfall will cause flooding of small
creeks and streams, country roads, farmland, and other low lying
spots.

In hilly terrain there are hundreds of low water crossings which are
potentially dangerous in heavy rain. Do not attempt to cross flooded
roads. Find an alternate route.

A Flood Advisory means river or stream flows are elevated, or ponding
of water in urban or other areas is occurring or is imminent.
